channel.title: Astronomy for the layman
channel.description:
Six programs on astronomy featuring Leon E. Salanave, lecturer in astronomy at Morrison Planetarium in San Francisco, and John Hopkins, interviewer. Produced with cooperation of California Academy of Sciences.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Telescopes and accessories
item.description: This program looks at "Telescopes and Accessories: The Astronomer's Tool Kit."
item.dc:creator: Pacifica Radio
item.dc:subject: Telescopes--Technological innovations

item.title: In the beginning
item.description: This program discusses the origin of the Solar System.
item.dc:creator: Pacifica Radio
item.dc:subject: Solar system--Origin

item.title: Analyzing starlight
item.description: This program, "Analyzing Starlight," looks at how starlight affects observations into space.
item.dc:creator: Pacifica Radio
item.dc:subject: Stars

item.title: Light of the night sky
item.description: This program "Light of the Night Sky" takes a look at zodiacal light.
item.dc:creator: Pacifica Radio
item.dc:subject: Zodiacal light

item.title: The sun in action
item.description: This program looks at "The Sun in Action," discussing sunspots, solar prominences, and other eruptions.
item.dc:creator: Pacifica Radio
item.dc:subject: Sunspots

item.title: Origins of asteroids
item.description: This program discusses recent theories on the origins of asteroids.
item.dc:creator: Pacifica Radio
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology
